📜 Constitution Day Live is almost here! On Sept. 17, the Bill of Rights Institute will celebrate the signing of the Constitution with new videos, resources, and classroom tools to help teachers bring civics to life. This years theme, Democracy in Your Backyard,  highlights how constitutional principles shape both historic struggles and everyday choices. Educators and students can look forward to: ✅ Civics on the Street with Catholic Universitys Prof. Matthew Green answering student questions. ✅ A new Primary Source Essentials video on the constitutional amendment process. ✅ Democracy in Action, exploring how the Constitution has guided Americans through pivotal moments in history. ✅ A spotlight on William Mar, the grand prize winner of BRIs MyImpact Challenge. And on Constitution Day itself, well premiere 3 more videos, including a civic leadership story, a mini-documentary on the Constitutional Convention, and a federalism discussion with Anastasia Boden of the Pacific Legal Foundation. ➡️ Read more and access resources:  https://bit.ly/3Ipvr5Y  #ConstitutionDay  #CivicEducation  #TeachingResources  #CivicEngagement
